title: UFC news: Dan Hardy advises Conor McGregor to take Dustin Poirier fight and avoid Justin Gaethje
text:
McGregor is yet to make any plans about his next fight (Picture: Getty)

Dan Hardy has urged Conor McGregor to stay away from Justin Gaethje and fight Dustin Poirier on his return to the UFC.

McGregor last fought a year ago and it is unclear when the Irishman might return.

The former lightweight and featherweight champion appears to have his heart set on fighting Khabib Nurmagomedov again, but Poirier, Donald Cerrone and Gaethje are the frontrunners to welcome McGregor back into the octagon.

‘If Conor is coming back to fight there are a couple of fights that make sense,’ Hardy told Metro.co.uk.

‘The Poirier fight is the one that makes sense to me, that’s the top of my list. Conor has a win over Poirier at featherweight.

‘I also don’t feel Poirier was the best version of himself at featherweight. I feel he’s a better fighter at lightweight.

‘Conor getting another win over Poirier at lightweight is impressive and would line him up as No.1 contender, if not a title shot.

‘Cowboy is another good win floating around because you can validate any fighter with a win over Cowboy.

‘Conor’s been out for a while so Cowboy might be a good reintroduction to the division.’

Another name mentioned for McGregor is featherweight veteran Frankie Edgar, but Hardy dismissed the prospect of that clash, saying: ‘There’s so little to be gained from beating Edgar, rather than getting a run out.’

Gaethje would love to fight McGregor (Picture: Getty)

While Poirier has been pushing hard for a rematch with McGregor, Gaethje recently launched a campaign to convince the UFC he is the right opponent.

Gaethje insists he has done everything possible to get the nod, but Hardy insisted McGregor should avoid that match-up.

‘Gaethje is a horrible fight for anyone in this division. If I’m Conor I’m going for Poirier or Cowboy,’ he said.

Poirier was beaten by McGregor at featherweight (Picture: Getty)

‘I don’t mind the Gaethje fight. I just think that’s a more risky fight for Conor to take. Gaethje is a different animal since his last couple of losses.

‘He’s picking his shots and not taking as much risks. He’s got a great wrestling game too.

‘Conor will feel more comfortable up against Poirier’s wrestling as he would be against Gaethje’s. Gaethje is a much riskier fight for Conor than anybody else, including Khabib.

‘I feel he’s got a good read on Khabib now so he’ll have a better chance of beating Khabib than Gaethje.’
